fi.luupanu.skrapple.domain

Class LetterBag

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.luupanu.skrapple.domain.LetterBag

  • public class LetterBag
extends Object
    LetterBag stores 101 Letters as per the rules of the game. After placing a word a player can then fill her rack again with random letters. Alternatively it's also possible to exchange letters without making a move.
    Author:
    panu

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LetterBag()
      Creates a new LetterBag with 101 letters inside as per the rules of the game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LetterBag

        public LetterBag()
        Creates a new LetterBag with 101 letters inside as per the rules of the game. Also creates a new Random used by takeRandomLetterFromBag().

        public Letter takeRandomLetterFromBag()
        Take one random letter from a bag.
        Returns:
        a random letter, null if the bag is empty.

      • removeLetterByIndex

        public boolean removeLetterByIndex(int i)
        Remove a letter from the bag with index i. Note: currently unused.
        Parameters:
        i - index of the letter
        Returns:
        true if the index was within the bag's bounds.

      • removeLetterByType

        public boolean removeLetterByType(LetterType t)
        Remove a letter from the bag by letter type.
        Parameters:
        t - the letter type of the letter to be removed
        Returns:
        true if the removal succeeded

      • removeAllLettersByType

        public int removeAllLettersByType(LetterType t)
        Optional method for banning certain letters from the game.
        Parameters:
        t - the letter type
        Returns:
        how many letters were removed
